meanings.definition: To sail about on a pleasure trip.
meanings.sent1: We were cruising on the lake in our small boat.
meanings.sent2: The family enjoyed cruising along the coast during their vacation.
meanings.sent3: The friends decided to go cruising on the calm waters for fun.
meanings.sent4: The sailboat was cruising through the waves like a graceful swan.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, they continued cruising, feeling the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: To travel at a constant speed.
meanings.sent1: The car was cruising down the highway at a steady pace.
meanings.sent2: The train was cruising through the countryside smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The bicycle was cruising along the path without any effort.
meanings.sent4: The spaceship was cruising through space at incredible speed.
meanings.sent5: The athlete was cruising towards the finish line with determination.

meanings.sent1: The old couple was cruising down the street in their classic car.
meanings.sent2: The cat was cruising around the house, exploring every corner.
meanings.sent3: The turtle was cruising along the sandy beach, taking its time.
meanings.sent4: The snail was cruising across the garden path at its own pace.
meanings.sent5: The river was cruising through the valley, meandering peacefully.
